Bash(bash -c '
# Source the functions from the script
unix_to_windows_path\(\) {
    local unix_path=""$1""
    local drive=$\(echo ""${unix_path:1:1}"" | tr ""[:lower:]"" ""[:upper:]""\)
    local rest=""${unix_path:2}""
    local rest_win=""${rest//\\//\\\\\\\\}""
    printf ""%s:%s\\n"" ""$drive"" ""$rest_win""
}

find_git_bash\(\) {
    local unix_paths=\(
        ""/d/Git/bin/bash.exe""
        ""/c/Program Files/Git/bin/bash.exe""
        ""/c/Program Files \(x86\)/Git/bin/bash.exe""
    \)

    for unix_path in ""${unix_paths[@]}""; do
        if [ -f ""$unix_path"" ]; then
            unix_to_windows_path ""$unix_path""
            return 0
        fi
    done
    return 1
}

# Simulate the script logic
if [ -z ""$CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH"" ]; then
    DETECTED_PATH=$\(find_git_bash\)
    if [ -n ""$DETECTED_PATH"" ]; then
        export CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH=""$DETECTED_PATH""
    else
        export CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH=""D:\\\\Git\\\\bin\\\\bash.exe""
    fi
else
    CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH=""${CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH//\\//\\\\\\\\}""
fi

echo ""CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH=$CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH""

# Verify the path actually exists
UNIX_CHECK=$\(echo ""$CLAUDE_CODE_GIT_BASH_PATH"" | sed ""s|\\\\\\\\|/|g"" | sed ""s|^\\\\\([A-Za-z]\\\\\):|/\\\\L\\\\1|""\)
echo ""Unix path for checking: $UNIX_CHECK""
if [ -f ""$UNIX_CHECK"" ]; then
    echo ""File exists: YES""
else
    echo ""File exists: NO""
fi
')
